page.title: 03Local History in PAUNTLEY
page.content:
{PAUNTLEY COURT}was the birthplace of{ {Richard (Dick) Whittington (c.1358). In June 1397 he was appointed{first {Lord Mayor of London}by the King. { } The present timber framed building dates from C1500 and is built on the base of the original mediaeval house. The house is not open to the public.{ The stone{dovecote}dates from C1500, remodeled C1700.
{PAUNTLEY CHURCH}(1170) has some fine{ {Norman}features. The Whittington Chapel and a stained glass window of the Whittington Arms are of interest.
These buildings, together with evidence of a water mill on the River Leadon formed the nucleus of a Norman settlement.
